Easy Cannoli

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a delightful dessert that combines a crispy shell with a creamy, sweet filling, look no further than these Easy Cannoli! This classic Italian treat, famous for its rich flavors and irresistible texture, is surprisingly simple to make at home. With just a handful of ingredients, including creamy ricotta cheese, sweet powdered sugar, and a touch of vanilla extract, you can create an authentic cannoli experience that will impress your friends and family. This recipe also incorporates mini chocolate chips and crunchy pistachios, adding layers of flavor and texture that elevate the traditional recipe. Whether you're preparing for a special occasion or just craving a sweet treat, these Easy Cannoli are sure to satisfy. Follow along as we guide you through this straightforward yet delicious recipe!

Ingredients

cannoli shells

You can buy pre-made cannoli shells at most grocery stores or Italian markets. If you're feeling adventurous, you can make your own using flour, sugar, butter, egg, and white wine. If you can't find cannoli shells, consider using waffle cones or pastry shells as a substitute, but keep in mind that the texture and flavor will differ.

ricotta cheese

Use whole milk ricotta for a creamier filling. If you want a lighter texture, you can strain the ricotta in a cheesecloth for a few hours to remove excess moisture. If you don't have ricotta, mascarpone cheese can be a delicious substitute, though it will be richer.

powdered sugar

Powdered sugar not only sweetens but also helps to create a smooth texture in the filling. If you want a less sweet filling, you can reduce the amount of powdered sugar or substitute it with an alternative sweetener like agave syrup or stevia, but adjust the quantity as necessary.

vanilla extract

For a deeper flavor, consider using pure vanilla extract instead of imitation vanilla. You can also add a splash of almond extract for a different profile, or infuse the ricotta with citrus zest (like lemon or orange) for a refreshing twist.

mini chocolate chips

Mini chocolate chips are great for even distribution in the filling. If you want a different flavor, try using chopped dark chocolate or white chocolate chips. For a healthier option, you could substitute with chopped dried fruit or nuts.

pistachios (chopped)

Chopped pistachios add a nice crunch and color contrast. You can substitute them with any other nut like almonds or hazelnuts, or even use a sprinkle of crushed graham crackers for a different texture. If you're looking for a nut-free option, consider using crushed pretzels for a salty-sweet crunch.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ricotta Filling

    In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ricotta cheese, 1 cup of powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Using a hand mixer or a whisk, beat the mixture until it becomes smooth and creamy. This step is crucial as it forms the base of your filling and ensures a delightful sweetness.

  • Step 2: Incorporate Chocolate Chips

    Once your ricotta mixture is smooth, gently fold in 1/2 cup of mini chocolate chips. Use a spatula to carefully mix, ensuring the chocolate chips are evenly distributed without over-mixing, which could make the filling watery.

  • Step 3: Fill the Cannoli Shells

    Prepare a piping bag or a ziplock bag by cutting off one corner. Carefully fill the bag with the ricotta mixture. Squeeze the filling into each of the 12 cannoli shells, starting from one end and filling it until the mixture starts to ooze out slightly from the other end. This ensures a well-filled cannoli.

  • Step 4: Garnish with Pistachios

    After filling the shells, dip each end of the cannoli into 1/4 cup of chopped pistachios. This not only adds a beautiful presentation but also gives a nice crunch and enhances the flavor profile.

  • Step 5: Serve or Refrigerate

    You can serve the cannoli immediately for the best texture, or refrigerate them for up to 2 hours. If refrigerating, cover them lightly to avoid them getting soggy. Enjoy your delicious homemade cannoli!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know if my ricotta cheese is fresh?

Check the expiration date on the package. Fresh ricotta should smell creamy and have a smooth texture. If it smells sour or has any discoloration, it's best to discard it.

What is the best way to fold in mini chocolate chips?

To fold in chocolate chips, use a spatula and gently lift the mixture from the bottom of the bowl to the top, turning it over rather than stirring vigorously. This keeps the mixture airy.

Can I make cannoli ahead of time?

Yes, but it’s best to fill the cannoli shells just before serving to keep them crisp. You can prepare the ricotta filling a day ahead and store it in the fridge.

What can I use if I don’t have a piping bag?

A ziplock bag works perfectly! Just fill it with the ricotta mixture, seal it, and cut a small corner off to pipe the filling into the shells.

How do I store leftover filled cannoli?

It's best to store filled cannoli in the fridge for up to a few hours. If you have leftover filling, keep it in a separate container and fill the shells just before serving to maintain their crunch.

What are some tips for making the filling smooth?

Make sure to use room temperature ricotta for easier mixing. If your ricotta has excess moisture, you can drain it in a fine mesh sieve for about 30 minutes before mixing.

How do I safely use a knife to chop pistachios?

Always use a stable cutting board and keep your fingers tucked in while holding the nuts. Make small, controlled cuts and work slowly until you achieve the desired chop.

Can I use other ingredients in the filling?

Absolutely! You can add other flavors like orange zest, almond extract, or swap chocolate chips for dried fruits or even chopped nuts.

What’s the easiest way to serve cannoli?

Arrange them on a platter and dust with powdered sugar just before serving for a beautiful presentation. Consider pairing with fresh berries for color!

How do I clean up after making cannoli?

Clean your mixing bowl and utensils immediately after use to prevent the filling from sticking. For any stubborn residue, soak them in warm soapy water before washing.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For gluten-free options, look for gluten-free cannoli shells or make your own using gluten-free flour. To create a dairy-free version, substitute ricotta with a vegan ricotta made from blended nuts or tofu, and use a powdered sugar alternative for sweetness.

Pairings

Pair your cannoli with a sweet dessert wine such as Vin Santo or a rich espresso to enhance the flavors. For a twist, try serving with a scoop of vanilla gelato or alongside fresh berries for a contrasting tartness.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the cannoli on a decorative platter, dusted lightly with powdered sugar for an elegant presentation. Consider adding a drizzle of chocolate sauce or caramel on the plate for a gourmet touch. For an extra flourish, garnish with a sprig of mint or edible flowers to enhance visual appeal.

#

Easy Cannoli

20 min
$10
300 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

DairyNuts

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertItalianEasy

Description

Delicious crispy shells filled with sweet ricotta cream, perfect for a quick dessert!

Ingredients

  • cannoli shells: 12
  • ricotta cheese: 2 cups
  • powdered sugar: 1 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • mini chocolate chips: 1/2 cup
  • pistachios (chopped): 1/4 cup

Date Created:

11/17/2024
